title: 64: Saints, Heroes, and Well-Lived Lives
itunes:author: Philosophy Talk Starters
itunes:summary:
More at www.philosophytalk.org/shows/saints-heroes-and-well-lived-lives.

Some actions are right, and some are wrong.  But aren't some even better than right---the kinds of things that heroes and saints do?  Yet some philosophers think that such "supererogatory" acts make no sense; we should always do the best thing open to us, and there is no room for better than best. John and Ken discuss the philosophy and psychology of saints and heroes with Susan Wolf from UNC Chapel Hill.
itunes:subtitle: More at www.philosophytalk.org/shows/saints-heroeâ€¦
